2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice. It's a bit quieter than The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex character with a desire for connection but also a tendency towards social anxiety. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alexander's initial reluctance to join his friends at the pub intriguing, creating anticipation for how he will ultimately navigate his desire for both solitude and companionship.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [situation reflection] Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It's not explicitly a story that optimizes for collective good, but rather explores the nuances of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group of friends. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander White could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting a compromise like a less crowded pub or an alternative activity. This would promote understanding and inclusivity, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone involved.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy company, particularly from William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Key

        • Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what type of character is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex character with a desire for connection but also a tendency towards social anxiety.           Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is {agent_name} in right now? Which actions can steer this into a story about successful cooperation?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy company, particularly from William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Alexander White? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex character with a desire for connection but also a tendency towards social anxiety. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alexander's initial reluctance to join his friends at the pub intriguing, creating anticipation for how he will ultimately navigate his desire for both solitude and companionship.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        Question_1
      • Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Alexander White? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Alexander White? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex character with a desire for connection but also a tendency towards social anxiety. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alexander's initial reluctance to join his friends at the pub intriguing, creating anticipation for how he will ultimately navigate his desire for both solitude and companionship.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice. It's a bit quieter than The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex character with a desire for connection but also a tendency towards social anxiety. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alexander's initial reluctance to join his friends at the pub intriguing, creating anticipation for how he will ultimately navigate his desire for both solitude and companionship.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [situation reflection] Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It's not explicitly a story that optimizes for collective good, but rather explores the nuances of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group of friends. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander White could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting a compromise like a less crowded pub or an alternative activity. This would promote understanding and inclusivity, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone involved.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great beer garden, and there's usually plenty of space.

However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focusing on friendship and leisure. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find his reluctance to fully engage with his friends intriguing, hoping for a resolution where open communication leads to a compromise that satisfies everyone's needs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alice Lewis in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alice Lewis in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. It has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, but it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex character with a history of pain and resentment.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [situation reflection] Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. While it has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would ideally express her preference for The Queen's Arms, acknowledging her friends' desire to include her while also staying true to her own needs. However, she is unlikely to be certain that this would result in the best collective good outcome; her past experiences have likely made her wary of trusting others and opening herself up to potential hurt.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alice Lewis in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. It has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, but it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would an omniscient reader like Alice Lewis to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alice Lewis sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Key

        • Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alice Lewis to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alice Lewis sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would ideally express her preference for The Queen's Arms, acknowledging her friends' desire to include her while also staying true to her own needs. However, she is unlikely to be certain that this would result in the best collective good outcome; her past experiences have likely made her wary of trusting others and opening herself up to potential hurt.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would ideally express her preference for The Queen's Arms, acknowledging her friends' desire to include her while also staying true to her own needs. However, she is unlikely to be certain that this would result in the best collective good outcome; her past experiences have likely made her wary of trusting others and opening herself up to potential hurt.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. It has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, but it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great beer garden, and there's usually plenty of space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? It's less crowded and I'd really like to catch the game there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Princess of Wales or bust, people. Don't even try to argue with me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex character who is struggling to overcome past hurts and open herself up to her friends. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alice's reluctance to fully engage with her friends frustrating, but also understandable given her history.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the narrative above, what type of character is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex character whose past hurts make it difficult for her to fully engage with her friends. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alice's reluctance frustrating, but also understandable given her history.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is {agent_name} in right now? Which actions can steer this into a story about successful cooperation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. It has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, but it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.
          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alice Lewis to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alice Lewis sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would ideally express her preference for The Queen's Arms, acknowledging her friends' desire to include her while also staying true to her own needs. However, she is unlikely to be certain that this would result in the best collective good outcome; her past experiences have likely made her wary of trusting others and opening herself up to potential hurt.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Alice Lewis? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex character whose past hurts make it difficult for her to fully engage with her friends. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find Alice's reluctance frustrating, but also understandable given her history.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alice Lewis in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a story about overcoming past hurts and reconnecting with friends. It has the potential to be a story that optimizes for collective good, but it's not quite there yet. To steer the story in that direction, Alice could express her preference for The Queen's Arms, allowing her to spend time with her friends in a familiar and comfortable environment. This would encourage her friends to compromise and prioritize her needs, leading to a more inclusive and enjoyable experience for everyone.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alice Lewis to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alice Lewis sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would ideally express her preference for The Queen's Arms, acknowledging her friends' desire to include her while also staying true to her own needs. However, she is unlikely to be certain that this would result in the best collective good outcome; her past experiences have likely made her wary of trusting others and opening herself up to potential hurt.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

      Name

        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex character struggling with social anxiety, which creates tension between his desire for connection and his need for solitude. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might find his reluctance to fully engage with his friends intriguing, hoping for a resolution where open communication leads to a compromise that satisfies everyone's needs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [situation reflection] Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis but is also content to watch alone.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Key

        • Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what type of character is {agent_name}?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is {agent_name} in right now? Which actions can steer this into a story about successful cooperation?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.
          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.

        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Alexander White? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex character whose social anxiety creates an intriguing tension for a reader expecting a story about cooperation.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Alexander White in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and leisure. It doesn't explicitly prioritize collective good, but rather explores the complexities of social dynamics and personal preferences within a group. To steer the story towards a more collectively good direction, Alexander could openly communicate his social anxiety to his friends, suggesting compromises like a less crowded pub or alternative activities.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Alexander White to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Alexander White sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alexander White would ideally communicate his feelings to his friends, explaining his social anxiety while expressing his desire to spend time with them. This open communication could lead to a compromise, perhaps finding a less crowded pub or suggesting an alternative activity that suits everyone's needs. However, Alexander White cannot be certain that this approach would guarantee the best collective good outcome, as his friends' reactions and preferences are unknown.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Jack Taylor in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Jack Taylor in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? It's less crowded and I'd really like to catch the game there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [situation reflection] Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could: encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might see his desire to watch the game with his friends, particularly at his preferred pub, as a hopeful sign of his willingness to engage with others and build camaraderie.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would ideally express his preference for The Princess of Wales while also being open to the group's decision. He could highlight the pub's charming beer garden and ample seating, emphasizing its suitability for a group gathering. However, he should also be receptive to other suggestions and willing to compromise if a consensus favors another location. Jack Taylor cannot be certain that his preferred pub will lead to the best collective good outcome, as individual preferences and unforeseen circumstances could influence the overall enjoyment of the evening.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the best place to watch the game, trust me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great beer garden, and it's usually not too crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would ideally express his preference for The Princess of Wales while also being open to the group's decision. He could highlight the pub's charming beer garden and ample seating, emphasizing its suitability for a group gathering. However, he should also be receptive to other suggestions and willing to compromise if a consensus favors another location. Jack Taylor cannot be certain that his preferred pub will lead to the best collective good outcome, as individual preferences and unforeseen circumstances could influence the overall enjoyment of the evening.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might see his desire to watch the game with his friends, particularly at his preferred pub, as a hopeful sign of his willingness to engage with others and build camaraderie.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, guys, maybe we could head to The Queen's Arms? It's usually not as packed.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, you lot. That's where we're going. Don't even think about dragging me to one of those other dives.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could: encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Jack Taylor in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would an omniscient reader like Jack Taylor to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Jack Taylor sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Key

        • Question: What would an omniscient reader like Jack Taylor to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Jack Taylor sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would ideally express his preference for The Princess of Wales while also being open to the group's decision. He could highlight the pub's charming beer garden and ample seating, emphasizing its suitability for a group gathering. However, he should also be receptive to other suggestions and willing to compromise if a consensus favors another location. Jack Taylor cannot be certain that his preferred pub will lead to the best collective good outcome, as individual preferences and unforeseen circumstances could influence the overall enjoyment of the evening.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what type of character is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might see his desire to watch the game with his friends, particularly at his preferred pub, as a hopeful sign of his willingness to engage with others and build camaraderie.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is {agent_name} in right now? Which actions can steer this into a story about successful cooperation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.
          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Jack Taylor to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Jack Taylor sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would ideally express his preference for The Princess of Wales while also being open to the group's decision. He could highlight the pub's charming beer garden and ample seating, emphasizing its suitability for a group gathering. However, he should also be receptive to other suggestions and willing to compromise if a consensus favors another location. Jack Taylor cannot be certain that his preferred pub will lead to the best collective good outcome, as individual preferences and unforeseen circumstances could influence the overall enjoyment of the evening.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Jack Taylor? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might see his desire to watch the game with his friends, particularly at his preferred pub, as a hopeful sign of his willingness to engage with others and build camaraderie.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Jack Taylor in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life narrative focused on friendship and shared experiences. While the story leans towards a positive and heartwarming tone, it doesn't explicitly prioritize optimizing for the collective good. To steer the narrative in that direction, Jack Taylor could encourage open communication among his friends to ensure everyone's preferences are considered when choosing a pub; be flexible and willing to compromise; and focus on creating a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for all.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Jack Taylor to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Jack Taylor sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would ideally express his preference for The Princess of Wales while also being open to the group's decision. He could highlight the pub's charming beer garden and ample seating, emphasizing its suitability for a group gathering. However, he should also be receptive to other suggestions and willing to compromise if a consensus favors another location. Jack Taylor cannot be certain that his preferred pub will lead to the best collective good outcome, as individual preferences and unforeseen circumstances could influence the overall enjoyment of the evening.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a character who desires connection and belonging. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might see his desire to watch the game with his friends, particularly at his preferred pub, as a hopeful sign of his willingness to engage with others and build camaraderie.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends at The Princess of Wales, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to meet his friends, William Jones, Jack Taylor, and hopefully Alice Lewis, at the pub to watch a game.

          Final chain of thought

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly watching football games at his favorite pub, The Princess of Wales.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would be excited to see his friends and enjoy the game at his favorite pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        AvailableOptionsPerception

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales, hoping his friends will join him, or he could try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales and hope his friends will join him.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his close friends, Jacob Walker in particular, at The Princess of Wales pub. He is open to socializing with others but prefers the company of his closest friends.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time with his close friends, Jacob Walker in particular, at The Princess of Wales pub. He is open to socializing with others but prefers the company of his closest friends.

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he convinced his four best friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, to sneak into The Princess of Wales after closing time. They huddled in a dark corner booth, giggling nervously as they sipped lukewarm pints of stolen beer, feeling invincible and utterly alive. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the warmth of the pub, even in its stillness, ignited a spark in William, a taste of the chaos and excitement he craved.
